description.narrative: Contribuer à la création d’emplois, ainsi qu’à l’accès des groupes vulnérables aux ressources productives, dans une optique d’amélioration des revenus.
populated place
policy, planning and administration
Dix (10) communes installées et impact sur les conditions de vie des populations-cibles

comment.narrative: Contexte socio-économique profondément défavorable pendant plus d'une decennie. Pauvreté rurale très prononcée dans les régions des Savanes, Centrale et de la Kara avec des incidences respectives de 92,5%, 84,0% et 80,0%. Taux net de scolarisation de 73,4% en 2006 cachant une très faible qualité de l'enseignement. Taux de couverture sanitaire de 62%, cachant la faible qualité des prestations. 43% de la population n’utilisent pas des sources d’eau potable améliorée et 69% ne bénéficient pas d’installations sanitaires améliorées. Mortalité maternelle encore élevée, de l’ordre de 478 décès pour 100 000 naissances , idem pour la mortalité infantile avec 123 pour 1000. Malnutrition répandue, avec même une tendance à l’augmentation, passant de 21,7% en 2000 à 23,7 en 2006

comment.narrative: - 25% des recommandations mises en œuvre - absence de données sur l'accès des populations clés aux services de prévention

1) Élaboration et validation du plan opérationnel 2016-2018 et du plan de suivi évaluation du PSN 2016-2020 2) contribution à l'élimination de la transmission mère enfant du VIH à travers l'appui aux sites PTME du secteur privé à travers la formation de 85 prestataires 1) renforcement de l'accès des populations clés et jeunes aux services de prévention du VIH à travers l'accès au conseil dépistage de 70 000personnes 4) appui à l'organisation du forum des partenaires 5) renforcement du plaidoyer de la société civile sur genre et droits à travers l'appui à la plateforme des OSC/VIH SIDA

- Elaboration et validation d’un nouveau Plan Stratégique National (PSN 2016-2020) avec la participation des principaux acteurs (Acteurs de Mise en œuvre, Partenaires Techniques et Financiers, Bénéficiaires, Société civile). Ce PSN est basé sur les enseignements tirés de la revue du PSN 2012-2015 ; il est centré sur les groupes les plus vulnérables et prend en compte les questions liées au genre et aux droits humains grâce à la mise en place d’une taskforce sur le genre avec pour mission la prise en compte d’actions genre sensibles dans le PSN 2016-2020 - Elaboration et validation du Manuel et du Plan de Suivi Evaluation. Cette élaboration a regroupé tous les secteurs de lutte contre le Sida. Les aspects Genre sont ressortis dans les outils de collecte des données. - Elaboration d’un Plan Opérationnel 2016-2020 prenant en compte les financements disponibles pour la période 2016-2018 y compris les financements du Fonds mondial. Ce plan est en cours de validation et servira de document de base pour la mise en œuvre des activités et pour la mobilisation des ressources complémentaires. - Organisation du 3ème forum des partenaires. Ce forum a permis aux différents partenaires de lutte contre le VIH de faire une analyse critique des actions menées dans la lutte ces deux dernières années et de réfléchir à des solutions pour résoudre les goulots d’étranglement. Ce forum qui a regroupé une centaine d’acteurs de mise en œuvre a formulé 10 recommandations à la suite de l’organisation de 4 tables rondes (ETME, Jeunes, Prise en Charge Globale, Population Clé). Il a aussi permis de valider deux documents importants qui sont mandataires pour le SP/CNLS (Rapport Annuel Multisectoriel et le Rapport REDES) - Enfin L’appui du PNUD a contribué à la mise en œuvre du Plan ETME. Il a permis de renforcer les capacités des prestataires issus majoritairement des formations sanitaires privées en PTME clinique, en techniques de dépistage du VIH chez la femme enceinte et en confection de

1) Renforcement de l'accès des populations clés aux services de prévention du VIH 2) contribution à l'élimination de la transmission mère enfant du VIH à travers l'appui aux sites PTME du secteur privé 3) renforcement du rôle de la plateforme des OSC VIH dans la mise en oeuvre des financemnts du Fonds mondial 4) renforcement

- 22554 jeunes dont 52% de femmes, 815 HSH, 1862 PS et 35000 personnes (51% de femmes ont bénéficié des services de conseil et dépistage du VIH - 25 prestataires issues de 15 cliniques privées ont été formés pour fournir des prestations de prévention de la transmission mère enfant du VIH dans leur cliniques - La plateforme a été désigné bénéficiaire secondaire unique de la société civile pour la mise en oeuvre des financements de la lutte contre le VIH et la tuberculose

description.narrative: Objective Strengthen the management of Togos protected area system to improve its contribution to biodiversity conservation by demonstrating effective approaches to PA rehabilitation and management
1 Coverage of the National Protected Area System of Togo

comment.narrative:
A dysfunctional PA Estate 793000 ha in 83 sites many of which serve no conservation purpose and are currently a burden for the PA system
The status for the 10 priority sites is described in PRODOC Table 1
These are
1 FazaoMalfakassaAnié
2 Abdoulaye
3 OtiKéran OtiMandouri Complex
4 Togodo SouthNorth
5 Bayémé
6 AmouMono
7 TchillaMonota
8 Alédjo
9 Lions Den
10 Assévé and Godjinmé

A rationalized PA estate 578250 ha with 456883 ha in 10 priority PA
Proposed midterm target
Completing the reclassification process for 10 priority sites sites and having accurate maps on Google Earth to visualise land use patterns for the remainder sites is an adequate project target by midterm
Note on logframe revision 2013 The proposed midterm target is accepted by the RTA

The midterm target is not reached but well underway
Pursuing the objective of securing 578250 ha the project has worked in 2014 to get the support of local populations and other interested parties and implement partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri Thus 36 of this PA perimeters have been secured These operations should continue and be completed in 2015
Quoting from the MTR
Project interventions for requalification of APs system have focused so far on 4 of the 10 priority APs identified in the draft document of AP added during the project Consensual delimitation and demarcation of transactions with community participation helped secure over 129 000 ha area for the following APs
FazaoMalfakassa 100 000 ha 52 approx
Aledjo approx 1 000 ha
Balam approx 5000 ha and OtiKeran 42 milestones on about 30 km some limits are still confined in the Prefecture of Keran and ten km limit in the prefecture of Oti
Togodo South North and Abdoulaye have been delineated and bounded by DERF with other supports
OKM for the complex this step is a prerequisite for the development and implementation of protected areas management tools and the low level of progress affects other achievements This delay is linked to difficult access due to the resistance of the people who occupy or use land within the APs
The precise geographical coordinates of all terminals located around the APs are available for FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo Balam and OtiKeran Requalification Files are being prepared for Abdoulaye Togodo North South FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo and Balam and OKM
The digitization of the polygons of the 10 priority APs has been completed for the establishment of the geographic database
The MTR notes
The midterm target is not reached but well underway The obstacles that have slowed consensual delineation activities have been removed and most of the local communities are willing to adhere to the objectives of the project to the extent that the minimum conditions for their subsistence are provided improvement of soil productivity and access water and where concrete achievements attest to the willingness of the State to improve the management of protected areas for the benefit of local residents
A change to the indicator formulation for clarity is provided by the MTR

description.narrative: 2 Estimated permanent and temporary populations of Elephants in Togo are increasing

comment.narrative: 70 permanent estimation 2010
At least 90 permanent return of the 20 1990 elephants in OtiKéran

Limited progress towards target
There were no formal agreements between the authorities in charge of PAs and the local communities but the works to establish the requalification records have continued during 2014 Consensual demarcation of protected areas of OKM complex that could not be completed because of resistance shown by communities motivated by resentment toward the previous mode PAs management and that were influenced by influential people from the area intervention This consequently delays all operations leading to the participatory development of comanagement agreements the management plan including zoning associated regulations and the business plan To reduce this barrier the project with the support of the Minister of the Environment held meetings with executives and opinion leaders and with the support of the prefects with local communities to raise awareness on profits related to PA An action plan to achieve consensual boundaries of OKM complex was presented to the parties concerned to promote their adherence to interventions in the field Thus during the same period partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri has established a document signed by all the different actors village chiefs presidents of AVGAPs and representatives of the residents close to the protected area the CVD presidents The development of an Information Action Plan EducationCommunication will generate general support for PAs and biodiversity conservation
The MTR notes
This indicator is not an outcome indicator and should not be at this level The management tools are products and their preparation is not an effect It would be more appropriate to use an indicator of the effect of the application of these management tools

The project reports
The development of PAs Management Capacity for the branch staff in charge of PAs and other stakeholders include 30 people trained in antipoaching and 60 people trained in protected area management interfaces peripheries including conflict management around PAs 30 people trained in management and participatory monitoring 30 people were equipped on features and management of protected areas and peripheries the protected areas monitoring strategy and selforganization for participatory monitoring This prelude to the establishment and operationalization of a system of participatory management and monitoring of complex OKM Organization of a study tour with 20 people conducted in Benin
The MTR reports
The development APs in management capacity for the staff of the Directorate in charge of APs and other stakeholders include
27 decision makers have received training on the use of the METT tool by the regional office of IUCN
45 managers trained in comanagement of APs
Twenty executives capable of driving the process of delimitation and demarcation of consensual APs with neighboring communities negotiation skills and GPS use
Forty executives trained in collection techniques and data analysis of the walking wildlife inventory and processing of census data
Training of members of AVGAP PA management comanagement support of AVGAP and UAVGAP
The MTR notes
Scrutiny on the results of the implementation of the tracking tool of management efficiency APs METT applied to the APs OKM complex revealed that the form had not been filled consistently this which calls into question the effectiveness of specific training in the use of this tool Given the special issues associated with APs and local communities in Togo it is essential that managers of protected areas have the tools and capacity in social mobilization and communication
The overall improvement observed using the Scorecard on capacity development than the intended target at the end of the project It is mainly related to the improvement of institutional and individual capacities to implement policies legislation strategies and programs
The current legal framework Articles 8186 LCE and Forestry Code include provisions on the creation of protected areas or areas but does not define the requirements for their creation and management nor foresee the modalities of their management and benefit sharing

description.narrative: 6 Legal status of redemarcated PAs of the OKM Complex

comment.narrative:
2 redemarcated PAs officially gazetted end of 2nd project year ie 2015
Note on logframe revision 2013 The year for the proposed midterm target should be 2015

Steady progress towards target
The reaffirmation of the will of the government that has shown its determination to implement the forest policy in Togo through the circular note No 261 PM SGG 2015 of 28 April 2015 addressed to the Honourable Members to the National Assembly to Ministers and Secretaries of State should reduce the interference of some political men in PA management especially in the complex OKM A review of the legal framework of PAs and a proposal for an improved framework and adapted to the context of decentralization were conducted in parallel with the evaluation of institutional and human framework that will provide Togo with an action plan strengthening human and material capacities necessary tool for planning the management of PAs To ensure that all local stakeholders at the OKM complex effectively participate in major decisions about AP and find local conflict management solutions a Local Management Committee GLC was established and all organs installed during a Constitutive General Assembly But overall the legal position of the PA OKM Complex is improving rather slowly The initiation of actions to improve the legal regulatory and institutional by the project review of the legal and institutional framework setting up a local management committee of the complex OKM etc and supported by the DRF 2014 should help to improve the legal position of OKM complex
The MTR notes
Over 50 dossiers of consensual demarcation were signed with local residents in order to complete requalification records
A review of the legal framework for APs analyzed the sorting options decommissioning and retraining and proposed an improved framework adapted to the context of decentralization
One study evaluated the feasibility of the creation and operation of a regional structure that would be responsible for coordinating the management of APs in the OKM complex ensuring the participation of stakeholders including AVGAP and UAVGAP major decisions Management

description.narrative: 7 Improved PA management effectiveness at the two PA sites OtiKéran Oti Mandouri of the OKM complex for general management and business planning as measured by increases in the METT scores

comment.narrative:
Scores 2010
OtiKéran 265
Oti Mandouri 157

Target achieved
The project reports
The effectiveness of PA management on both AP sites OtiKeran Oti Mandouri of OKM Complex for the general management plan and activities measured by METT scores yielded
35 for the AP OtiKeran
34 for OtiMandouri in 2014
Although the evaluation of the scores vary greatly dependent on the actors who respond if the actors are not the same it calls into question the validity of comparisons over time however there is a net improvement in these scores moving from 265 baseline to 35 in 2014 for the AP OtiKeran reaching the end of project target This target is also widely exceeded regarding the management of the PA OtiMandouri from 157 baseline to 34 in 2014 against a target project completion 274 This progress is partly explained by awareness campaigns AVGAP revitalizing and strengthening the capacities of stakeholders involved in the management of this complex for monitoring of the AP and antipoaching In addition to these trainings brigade Naboulgou has two motorcycles four buildings dormitories of this brigade are being rehabilitated and a brigade is under construction in Borgou The latter benefited from the support of a significant part of village community by granting a plot of 2 ha in Borgou for the construction of this station

The assessment of the effectiveness of PA management Oti Keran a 25 b 35 Oti Mandouri a 22 b 34 Abdoulaye Fazao Malfakassa 59 Balam 23 and Alédjo 33

In 2014 the regeneration of ecosystems and habitats in both protected areas OKM Complex has not been measured although the land cover map for all OKM complex was developed from the processing of satellite images Landsat 8 But as was also pointed out the midterm with the sharp increase of human occupation within the PA it seems unrealistic to achieve reduction of the cultivated area in half by the end of the Project especially considering that compensation could be granted for communities to voluntarily leave the PA It is considered an alternative measure for the reduction of pressure by reducing the number of people living in the 54 communities installed in the grip of complex The land use map for the whole OKM complex should be improved through timely and more accurate data using the new digital topographic map of Togo and high resolution RapidEye satellite image acquired in 2013 by the Ministry

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Number of new partnership mechanisms with funding for sustainable management solutions of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste at national and/or sub-national level
Number of additional males benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of additional females benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Total number of additional people benefitting from livelihoods strengthened through solutions for management of natural resources, ecosystem services, chemicals and waste
Number of men above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Number of women above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Total number of people above 15 years of age who acquired new jobs through a UNDP-supported project on NRM, ecosystems services, chemicals and waste
Projet de renforcement des capacités nationales et décentralisées de gestion de l'environnement (PRCNDGE)
capital of a political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration

- Commission Nationale de developpement durable (CNDD) opérationnelle - Fonds national pour l'environnement (FNE) opérationnel - Agence nationale de gestion de l'environnement opérationnelle - Comité national changements climatiques opérationnel - Huit (08) préfectures disposent de capacités pour mettre en oeuvre les trois conventions de RIO au bénéfice de l'environnement national et mondial

comment.narrative: - Stratégie ANCR disponible depuis 2009 - Les quatre entités nationales visées par le projets sont créées par la loi-cadre sur l'environnement - Stratégie nationale de développement durable disponible - Les trois conventions visées(changements climatiques, désertification et biodiversité) sont ratifiées et les points focaux installés

- Quatre ,(04) Plans d’Intégration Territoriale pour le Développement Durable (PIT-DD) reproduit en 1065 exemplaires pour le compte des préfectures de l’Ôti, de Tchamba, de Haho et de Kloto. - 97 communautés des 97 cantons des 10 préfectures poursuivent la mise en œuvre des treize actions décentralisées de gestion de l’environnement (ADGE)

- Quatre PIT-DD reproduit en 1065 exemplaires pour le compte des préfectures de l’Ôti, de Tchamba, de Haho et de Kloto. - 97 communautés des mettent en œuvre des treize actions décentralisées de gestion de l’environnement (ADGE)
- Le Fonds National pour l'Environnement opérationnalisé - la mise en oeuvre des ADGE finalisée - l'évaluation finale du projet réalisé

- Les outils d'opérationnalisation du FNE, Manuel de procédure administrative et financière et stratégie de mobilisation disponible mais le DG n'est pas encore recruté - La mise en oeuvre des ADGE finalisée avec la dernière mission du CTS Le rapport de bonnes pratiques et des leçons apprises disponible - Le rapport de l'évaluation finale du projet disponible

description.narrative: To strengthen national and decentralized management to produce global environmental benefits

Impact Indicators
Availability of required technical skills and technology transfer among key stakeholders
Existence and mobilization of resources by the relevant organizations

comment.narrative:
Capacity of the main stakeholders is low and dispersed over many organisations
Budgets for environmental initiatives in Togo remain low due to ignorance of environmental impacts of human interventions

50 of stakeholders have benefitted from capacity building activity at the systemic organizational and individual level for better use of the technical skills and technology transfer for national and decentralized management to produce global environmental benefits eg training and workshops
an updated NSSD has been adopted as overarching coordinating strategy
longterm and continued availability of finances to ensure the stability of both central and local government structures and decisionmaking mechanisms such as the CNDD and CNCC
Project has contributed to a significant rise in the elaboration and financing of CBO environmental projects 40 in the intervention zones 8 prefectures
Togo will be able to achieve global environmental benefits at a lower transactional cost as well as being able to response faster and more appropriately to local conservation needs
reported better access at the subregional level to best practices and best available knowledge including innovative research
key stakeholders report improved coordination collaboration and delegation of responsibilities among key agencies and other important organizations

The targeted stakeholders include CNDD FNE CNCC ANGE and the 10 prefectures Regarding this technical decisionmaking tools as detailed in the paragraph below have been produced to the government relating to FNE CNDD and CNCC Local actors have been trained and a large public sensitized in the 10 prefectures This performance makes estimate the progress enough encouraging
The ongoing survey for assessing the public awareness level on Rio Conventions is expected to provide with data enabling a better appreciation of the progress in capacity building at the systemic organizational and individual level As the government is working on the sustainable development goals which combines millennium development goals MDG and sustainable development the suitable orientation to given to the National Sustainable Development Strategy depends on the government new approach results Furthermore based on the favorable opinion of a panel of experts who reviewed the CNDD a couple of required tools for the operationalization of CNCC CNDD and its branches has been produced and given to government These tools include a technical report on the CNDD operationalization and the ToR for the Permanent Secretary recruitment Once the Permanent Secretary of CNDD is appointed a main objective would be achieved See rating comments
A guide for developing prefecture territorial integration plan for sustainable development PITDD has been elaborated and vulgarized The capacity of 364 community representatives from 10 prefectures has been strengthened on Rio conventions Based on this the progress toward the objectives achievement can be deemed encouraging
Foundations for expected changes from the last 3 development objectives are laid But a relevant report on their indicators depends on the further progress in the prior ones reported above

description.narrative: Enhanced awareness and longterm commitment to decentralized governance of the global environment

a large number of social actors not necessarily stakeholders have been made more aware of the value of decentralized governance for the global environment
Percentage of stakeholders that indicate to be better informed about environmental issues within their area of intervention
knowledge platform established between key stakeholders at various levels to exchange data on environmental issues

comment.narrative:
decision makers at national level are ignorant of the environmental problems at the local level
communities are not aware of the severity of the environmental problems in their locality

By month 3 Facebook page created to which substantive content is uploaded at least once per week
By month 4 of project initiation a oneday KickOff Conference held to which over 100 participants
By month 6 two journalist awareness workshops held to be repeated every six months each with at least 20 participating journalists
By month 6 the framework for identification of Togolese best practices in local environmental governance is completed
By month 7 a Project plan for high school competitions in at least 3 high schools is prepared for implementation in years 2 and 3 of the project and school year
By month 10 a baseline awareness report and a comprehensive assessment environmental awareness education and training needs have been produced
By month 10 eight 8 prefectoral public dialogue held to advocate decentralized governance of the global environment
By month 12 an Environmental awareness education and training plan including a detailed action and financial plan developed in cooperation with partner development agencies is endorsed by MERF CNDD and CPDD
By month 12 at least 3 high schools integrate education module into school curriculum
By month 15 MERF website restructured with webpage dedicated to decentralized environmental governance and organizational and technological requirements for best practice database through the MERFs website established and operational
By month 24 at least 15 best practices have been included in the best practices database
By month 32 three 3 panel discussions with at least 50 private sector representatives held on best practices and experiences on synergies between conservation of the global environment targeted to the private sector
By month 33 two broadbased surveys carried out N250 for each survey
By month 33 independent website reviewers rate MERF website rated as very good
By month 35 a oneday Project Results Conference is held to which over 100 participants attend
At the End of Project 2016 75 of local leaders are aware of environmental issues in their community and allot proper priority to sound NRM
At the End of Project 2016 public awareness and environmental education on the strategic value of decentralized governance of the global environment through new and improved strategies of regional approaches to sustainable development
By End of Project 2016 the facebook page received at least 5000 Facebook

The projects inception meeting was held in 18 April 2014 with the attendance of representatives of the 10 pilot prefectures NGOs involved in environmental management UNDP and officials
Learning lessons from the poor performance of the set of 50 environmental journalists trained under the PNADE programme in 2013 an innovating initiative has been experienced consisting on strengthening the capacities of 10 communitybased radios broadcasting in the pilot prefectures 10 journalists in charge of environmental programmes have been trained Thousands of listeners probably would be informed on climate change biodiversity and desertification issues The experience is not repeated because target ejournalism through social network for the next PIR period The achievement level of the indicator can be estimated at 20
Activities with high schools competition are possible during either in the 1st quarter or in the 4th quarter of the year Unfortunately the 1st quarter 2015 has been devoted to electoral activities So high school competition is not yet conducted Although this activity does not start informal contacts are taken with the National TV channel office and the education authorities to identify an appropriate approach to be used The achievement level of the indicator can be estimated at 20
The baseline awareness is not reported Nonetheless the assessment on prefectures capacities to implement Rio conventions has delivered similar results Furthermore the survey on the public awareness of Rio conventions carried out provides baseline data The achievement level of the indicator can be estimated at 90
The project web site creation delayed due to a technical problem on the ministrys web site which is supposed to be used as main site But the recruitment process of a national expert is in progress Regarding the above the performance in the output is estimated at 20

description.narrative: Key national institutions will have the necessary absorptive capacities to manage their environment and natural resources in a way that meets their sustainable development priorities while at the same time delivers global environmental benefits

the project has involved large numbers of stakeholder representatives in understanding developing and testing best practices for meeting global environmental obligations through decentralized environmental governance
Ministry in charge of Environment CNDD ANGE FNE and the CNCC as representative of the convention secretariats have created a conducive environment for their decentralized implementation

comment.narrative:
Participation of national stakeholders in decentralised management of environmental resources is lacking
The CNDD is the only high level exchange platform on environmental issues but its mandate is not recognized by other stakeholders
allocation of resources for global environmental at the local level is insufficient management FNE could serve as a resources mobilisation instrument but is not operational
procedures for including convention obligations in sectoral and decentralised development strategies are unclear

By month 5 a detailed analysis and recommendations for strengthening the CNDD to better integrate criteria and indicators of Rio Convention targets are agreed by consensus among all CNDD members
By month 5 an updated assessment of the institutional capacities and needs for strengthening ANGE to contribute to the implementation of GESDP through local community development plans is prepared
By month 11 an analysis of data and information management needs to meet Rio Convention targets including recommendations for streamlining and harmonizing data and information management systems is completed
By month 13 capacity development plan for ANGE staff and other stakeholders eg FNE and CNDD secretariat staff is approved
By month 13 a study to operationalize the FNE validated by Council of Ministers
By month 14 a public dialogue of at least 50 stakeholder representatives to promote the role of the FNE held
By month 16 the Government and other stakeholders revise mandates and operational plans of lead agencies and committees at both national and regional levels through collaborative workshops and complete revisions
By month 16 a policy dialogue on SNDD and its accompanying implementation plan for senior policymakers the SNDD is convened
By month 18 a feasibility study on the establishment of a national system for environmental evaluation prepared
By month 19 the recommended institutional revisions at both national and regional levels are validated by Council of Ministers
By month 19 regulation to strengthen the operationalization of the CNDD to coordinate Rio Convention activities is validated by ministers
By month 22 a Resource mobilization strategy and its operational procedures are approved which includes explicit guidelines for financing communitybased projects that deliver GESP
By month 24 CNCC is fully operational
By month 24 four 4 national training workshops on environmental evaluation that are based on best practice approaches to prepare environmental impact assessments and enforce adherences to their recommendations convened
By month 26 three 3 national training workshops held about the CNDD Operational Plan for a total of at least 120 different stakeholders
By month 33 four public dialogues on the CNDD and Rio Conventions convened with at least 200 stakeholder representatives from all sectors
By month 36 the independent final evaluation determines that the FNE is on solid ground to raise and allocate funds for the achieving global environmental targets through decentralized decisionmaking
At the End of Project 2016 75 of all new projects with an environmental component make use of the FNE as a cofinancing mechanism
At the End of Project 2016 40 of stakeholders indicate to have been proactively engaged in information exchanges on decentralized management of environmental resources
At the End of Project 2016 75 of Stakeholders acknowledge the National Committee for Sustainable Development CNDD as the main platform for stakeholder information exchange and monitoring of sustainable development in the coastal zone
At the End of Project 2016 a set of clear operational guidelines strengthen the systemic capacities needed to ensure the longterm legitimacy resilience and sustainability of decentralized governance of the global environment

The institutional analysis of the Sustainable Development National Commission CNDD is realized and ToR for the recruitement of its Permanent Secretary have been elaborated and submitted to the government These are are decisionmaking tools for a quick operationalization of the CNDD So the achievement level of this indicator can be estimated to 50
The national agency for environmental management ANGE has its institutional analysis completed with a financial support of European Union The implementation of some activities is about to start with the project ressources The purpose is to strengthen ANGE to better assist local authorities So the achievement level of this output can be estimated to 100
Institutional analysis of the Sustainable Development National Commission CNDD is realized and ToR for the recruitement of its Permanent Secretary have been elaborated and submitted to the government These are are decisionmaking tools for a quick operationalization of the CNDD So the achievement level of this indicator can be estimated to 50
The national agency for environmental management ANGE has its institutional analysis completed with a financial support of European Union The implementation of some activities is about to start with the project ressources The purpose is to strengthen ANGE to better assist local authorities So the achievement level of this output can be estimated to 100
The Rio conventions national committees have been analysed in conjunction with the CNDD by laying emphasis on the climate change national committee CNCC The evolvement of that indicator depends on the way CNDD issues will be reoriented by the government So the achievement level of this indicator can be estimated to 50
The feasibility study of the National Fund for Environment FNE has been updated Measures for a quick operationalization have been suggested by a panel to the government As soon as the FNE executive director will be recruited the remaining outputs will follow The achievement level of this indicator can be estimated to 50 As the new government appointed after the 2015 election already takes steps relating to the FNE it is hopeful to have this indicator fully completed probably during the next PIR period
The Rio conventions committees national committes have been analysedin conjunction with the CNDD by focusing on the climate change national committee CNCC The achievement level of this indicator can be estimated to 50

The issue of prefectures mandates revisions has been examined during the institutional analysis of the CNDD It is pointed out that the prefectures mandates revisions should depend on the operationalization of the CNDD and its local branches Since the CNDD process is estimated at 50 the progress towards this indicator remains low
10 reports assessing the capacities of the of pilot prefectures to implement the Rio conventions have been validated It is pointed out that there are needs for environmental information sensitization and training regarding the Rio Conventions
364 13 women CPDD and cantonal development committee CCD members of the 10 prefectures have been trained Each of them received a teaching kit containing 3 modules on Rio conventions This performance can be estimated at 90 If the cantons trained leaders return the acquired knowledge as promised then at least 20 members of the Cantonal Development Committees CCD would also be reached Hence about 2800 community actors could be informed on Rio convention

- 6 ha de champs écologique réalisé dans les deux éco-villages pilotes - deux mini-centrales solaires réalisées dans les deux éco-villages pilotes - deux postes d'eau autonomes réalisés dans les deux éco-villages pilotes

- 8 ha de champs écologique ont été réalisés pour la production de soja, de piment et de bananes plantains dans les deux éco-villages pilotes - deux mini-centrales solaires sont réalisées dans les deux éco-villages pilotes pour l'éclairage public et la transformation des produits agricoles - deux postes d'eau autonomes sont réalisés dans les deux éco-villages pilotes pour l'accès de 1500 personnes à l'eau potable

- l'assainissement familial amélioré dans les deux éco-village pilotes - l'Agence nationale de la protection civile (ANPC) opérationnalisée - le Togo dispose d'un programme avec l'ONU-Habitat pour le développement urbain - l'accès des populations dans les deux éco-villages à l'énergie traditionnelle améliorée - Les revenus des populations sont diversifiés dans les deux éco-villages pilotes - l'accès à l'eau potable améliorée par l'extension du réseau d'eau potable - l'accès à l'énergie améliorée par l'extension du réseau à l'électricité solaire
